1.verse: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel:

2.verse: To know wisdom and instruction;

3.verse: To receive instruction in wise dealing,

4.verse: To give prudence to the simple,

5.verse: That the wise man may hear, and increase in learning;

6.verse: To understand a proverb, and  a figure,

7.verse: The fear of Jehovah is the  beginning of knowledge;

8.verse: My son, hear the instruction of thy father,

9.verse: For they shall be a chaplet of grace unto thy head,

10.verse: My son, if sinners entice thee,

11.verse: If they say, Come with us,

12.verse: Let us swallow them up alive as Sheol,

13.verse: We shall find all precious substance;

14.verse: Thou shalt cast thy lot among us;

15.verse: My son, walk not thou in the way with them;

16.verse: For their feet run to evil,

17.verse: For in vain is the net spread

18.verse: And these lay wait for their own blood;

19.verse: So are the ways of every one that is greedy of gain;

20.verse: Wisdom crieth aloud in the street;

21.verse: She crieth  in the chief place of concourse;

22.verse: How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity?

23.verse: Turn you at my reproof:

24.verse: Because I have called, and ye have refused;

25.verse: But ye have set at nought all my counsel,

26.verse: I also will laugh in the day of your calamity;

27.verse: When your fear cometh as  a storm,

28.verse: Then will they call upon me, but I will not answer;

30.verse: They would none of my counsel,

31.verse: Therefore shall they eat of the fruit of their own way,

32.verse: For the backsliding of the simple shall slay them,

33.verse: But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell securely,

1.verse: My son, if thou wilt receive my words,

2.verse: So as to incline thine ear unto wisdom,

3.verse: Yea, if thou cry after discernment,

4.verse: If thou seek her as silver,

5.verse: Then shalt thou understand the fear of Jehovah,

6.verse: For Jehovah giveth wisdom;

7.verse: He layeth up sound wisdom for the upright;

8.verse: That he may guard the paths of justice,

9.verse: Then shalt thou understand righteousness and justice,

10.verse: For wisdom shall enter into thy heart,

11.verse: Discretion shall watch over thee;

12.verse: To deliver thee from the way of  evil,

13.verse: Who forsake the paths of uprightness,

14.verse: Who rejoice to do evil,

15.verse: Who are crooked in their ways,

16.verse: To deliver thee from the strange woman,

17.verse: That forsaketh the  friend of her youth,

18.verse: For  her house inclineth unto death,

19.verse: None that go unto her return again,

20.verse: That thou mayest walk in the way of good men,

21.verse: For the upright shall dwell in the  land,

22.verse: But the wicked shall be cut off from the land,

1.verse: My son, forget not my  law;

2.verse: For length of days, and years of life,

3.verse: Let not kindness and truth forsake thee:

4.verse: So shalt thou find favor and  good understanding

5.verse: Trust in Jehovah with all thy heart,

6.verse: In all thy ways acknowledge him,

7.verse: Be not wise in thine own eyes;

8.verse: It will be health to thy navel,

9.verse: Honor Jehovah with thy substance,

10.verse: So shall thy barns be filled with plenty,

11.verse: My son, despise not the  chastening of Jehovah;

12.verse: For whom Jehovah loveth he reproveth,

13.verse: Happy is the man that findeth wisdom,

14.verse: For the gaining of it is better than the gaining of silver,

15.verse: She is more precious than rubies:

16.verse: Length of days is in her right hand;

17.verse: Her ways are ways of pleasantness,

18.verse: She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her:

19.verse: Jehovah by wisdom founded the earth;

20.verse: By his knowledge the depths were broken up,

21.verse: My son, let them not depart from thine eyes;

22.verse: So shall they be life unto thy soul,

23.verse: Then shalt thou walk in thy way securely,

24.verse: When thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid:

25.verse: Be not afraid of sudden fear,

26.verse: For Jehovah will be thy confidence,

27.verse: Withhold not good from them to whom it is due,

28.verse: Say not unto thy neighbor, Go, and come again,

29.verse: Devise not evil against thy neighbor,

30.verse: Strive not with a man without cause,

31.verse: Envy thou not the man of violence,

32.verse: For the perverse is an abomination to Jehovah;

33.verse: The curse of Jehovah is in the house of the wicked;

34.verse: Surely he scoffeth at the scoffers;

1.verse: Hear, my sons, the instruction of a father,

2.verse: For I give you good doctrine;

3.verse: For I was a son unto my father,

4.verse: And he taught me, and said unto me:

5.verse: Get wisdom, get understanding;

6.verse: Forsake her not, and she will preserve thee;

7.verse: Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom;

8.verse: Exalt her, and she will promote thee;

9.verse: She will give to thy head a chaplet of grace;

10.verse: Hear, O my son, and receive my sayings;

11.verse: I have taught thee in the way of wisdom;

12.verse: When thou goest, thy steps shall not be straitened;

13.verse: Take fast hold of instruction; let her not go:

14.verse: Enter not into the path of the wicked,

15.verse: Avoid it, pass not by it;

16.verse: For they sleep not, except they do evil;

17.verse: For they eat the bread of wickedness,

18.verse: But the path of the righteous is as the dawning light,

19.verse: The way of the wicked is as darkness:

20.verse: My son, attend to my words;

21.verse: Let them not depart from thine eyes;

22.verse: For they are life unto those that find them,

23.verse: Keep thy heart  with all diligence;

24.verse: Put away from thee a wayward mouth,

25.verse: Let thine eyes look right on,

26.verse: Make level the path of thy feet,

27.verse: Turn not to the right hand nor to the left:

1.verse: My son, attend unto my wisdom;

2.verse: That thou mayest preserve discretion,

3.verse: For the lips of a strange woman drop honey,

4.verse: But in the end she is bitter as wormwood,

5.verse: Her feet go down to death;

6.verse: So that she findeth not the level path of life:

7.verse: Now therefore, my sons, hearken unto me,

8.verse: Remove thy way far from her,

9.verse: Lest thou give thine honor unto others,

10.verse: Lest strangers be filled with thy  strength,

11.verse: And thou  mourn at thy latter end,

12.verse: And say, How have I hated instruction,

13.verse: Neither have I obeyed the voice of my teachers,

14.verse: I was well-nigh in all evil

15.verse: Drink waters out of thine own cistern,

16.verse: Should thy springs be dispersed abroad,

17.verse: Let them be for thyself alone,

18.verse: Let thy fountain be blessed;

19.verse: As a loving hind and a pleasant doe,

20.verse: For why shouldest thou, my son,  be ravished with a strange woman,

21.verse: For the ways of man are before the eyes of Jehovah;

22.verse: His own iniquities shall take the wicked,

23.verse: He shall die for lack of instruction;

1.verse: My son, if thou art become surety for thy neighbor,

2.verse: Thou art snared with the words of thy mouth,

3.verse: Do this now, my son, and deliver thyself,

4.verse: Give not sleep to thine eyes,

5.verse: Deliver thyself as a  roe from the hand of the hunter ,

6.verse: Go to the ant, thou sluggard;

7.verse: Which having no  chief,

8.verse: Provideth her bread in the summer,

9.verse: How long wilt thou  sleep, O sluggard?

10.verse: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber,

11.verse: So shall thy poverty come as a  robber,

12.verse: A worthless person, a man of iniquity,

13.verse: That winketh with his eyes, that  speaketh with his feet,

14.verse: In whose heart is perverseness,

15.verse: Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly;

16.verse: There are six things which Jehovah hateth;

17.verse: Haughty eyes, a lying tongue,

18.verse: A heart that deviseth wicked purposes,

19.verse: A false witness that  uttereth lies,

20.verse: My son, keep the commandment of thy father,

21.verse: Bind them continually upon thy heart;

22.verse: When thou walkest, it shall lead thee;

23.verse: For  the commandment is a lamp; and  the law is light;

24.verse: To keep thee from the evil woman,

25.verse: Lust not after her beauty in thy heart;

26.verse: For on account of a harlot a man is brought to a piece of bread;

27.verse: Can a man take fire in his bosom,

28.verse: Or can one walk upon hot coals,

29.verse: So he that goeth in to his neighbor’s wife;

30.verse: Men do not despise a thief, if he steal

31.verse: But if he be found, he shall restore sevenfold;

32.verse: He that committeth adultery with a woman is void of  understanding:

33.verse: Wounds and dishonor shall he get;

34.verse: For jealousy is the rage of a man;

35.verse: He will not regard any ransom;

1.verse: My son, keep my words,

2.verse: Keep my commandments and live;

3.verse: Bind them upon thy fingers;

4.verse: Say unto wisdom, Thou art my sister;

5.verse: That they may keep thee from the strange woman,

6.verse: For at the window of my house

7.verse: And I beheld among the simple ones,

8.verse: Passing through the street near her corner;

9.verse: In the twilight, in the evening of the day,

10.verse: And, behold, there met him a woman

11.verse: (She is  clamorous and wilful;

12.verse: Now she is in the streets, now in the broad places,

13.verse: So she caught him, and kissed him,

14.verse: Sacrifices of peace-offerings  are with me;

15.verse: Therefore came I forth to meet thee,

16.verse: I have spread my couch with  carpets of tapestry,

17.verse: I have  perfumed my bed

18.verse: Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning;

19.verse: For the man is not at home;

20.verse: He hath taken a bag of money with him;

21.verse: With her much fair speech she causeth him to yield;

22.verse: He goeth after her  straightway,

23.verse: Till an arrow strike through his liver;

24.verse: Now therefore, my sons, hearken unto me,

25.verse: Let not thy heart decline to her ways;

26.verse: For she hath cast down many wounded:

27.verse: Her house is the way to Sheol,

1.verse: Doth not wisdom cry,

2.verse: On the top of high places by the way,

3.verse: Beside the gates, at the entry of the city,

4.verse: Unto you, O men, I call;

5.verse: O ye simple, understand prudence;

6.verse: Hear, for I will speak excellent things;

7.verse: For my mouth shall utter truth;

8.verse: All the words of my mouth  are in righteousness;

9.verse: They are all plain to him that understandeth,

10.verse: Receive my instruction, and not silver;

11.verse: For wisdom is better than rubies;

12.verse: I wisdom have made prudence my dwelling,

13.verse: The fear of Jehovah is to hate evil:

14.verse: Counsel is mine, and  sound knowledge:

15.verse: By me kings reign,

16.verse: By me  princes rule,

17.verse: I love them that love me;

18.verse: Riches and honor are with me;

19.verse: My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold;

20.verse: I walk in the way of righteousness,

21.verse: That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance,

22.verse: Jehovah  possessed me in  the beginning of his way,

23.verse: I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning,

24.verse: When there were no depths, I was brought forth,

25.verse: Before the mountains were settled,

26.verse: While as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields,

27.verse: When he  established the heavens, I was there:

28.verse: When he made firm the skies above,

29.verse: When he gave to the sea  its bound,

30.verse: Then I was by him, as a master workman;

32.verse: Now therefore, my sons, hearken unto me;

34.verse: Blessed is the man that heareth me,

35.verse: For whoso findeth me findeth life,

36.verse: But he that  sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul:

1.verse: Wisdom hath builded her house;

2.verse: She hath killed her beasts; she hath mingled her wine;

3.verse: She hath sent forth her maidens;

4.verse: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither:

5.verse: Come, eat ye of my bread,

6.verse: Leave off, ye simple ones, and live;

7.verse: He that correcteth a scoffer getteth to himself reviling;

8.verse: Reprove not a scoffer, lest he hate thee:

9.verse: Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser:

10.verse: The fear of Jehovah is the beginning of wisdom;

11.verse: For by me thy days shall be multiplied,

12.verse: If thou art wise, thou art wise for thyself;

13.verse: The foolish woman is clamorous;

14.verse: And she sitteth at the door of her house,

15.verse: To call to them that pass by,

16.verse: Whoso is simple, let him turn in hither;

17.verse: Stolen waters are sweet,

18.verse: But he knoweth not that  the dead are there;

1.verse: The proverbs of Solomon.

2.verse: Treasures of wickedness profit nothing;

3.verse: Jehovah will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish;

4.verse: He becometh poor that worketh with a slack hand;

5.verse: He that gathereth in summer is  a wise son;

6.verse: Blessings are upon the head of the righteous;

7.verse: The memory of the righteous is blessed;

8.verse: The wise in heart will receive commandments;

9.verse: He that walketh uprightly walketh surely;

10.verse: He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow;

11.verse: The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life;

12.verse: Hatred stirreth up strifes;

13.verse: In the lips of him that hath discernment wisdom is found;

14.verse: Wise men lay up knowledge;

15.verse: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city:

16.verse: The labor of the righteous tendeth to life;

17.verse: He  is in the way of life that heedeth  correction;

18.verse: He that hideth hatred is of lying lips;

19.verse: In the multitude of words there wanteth not transgression;

20.verse: The tongue of the righteous is as choice silver:

21.verse: The lips of the righteous feed many;

22.verse: The blessing of Jehovah, it maketh rich;

23.verse: It is as sport to a fool to do wickedness;

24.verse: The fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him;

25.verse: When the whirlwind passeth, the wicked is no more;

26.verse: As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes,

27.verse: The fear of Jehovah  prolongeth days;

28.verse: The hope of the righteous shall be gladness;

29.verse: The way of Jehovah is a stronghold to the upright;

30.verse: The righteous shall never be removed;

31.verse: The mouth of the righteous  bringeth forth wisdom;

32.verse: The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable;

1.verse: A false balance is an abomination to Jehovah;

2.verse: When pride cometh, then cometh shame;

3.verse: The integrity of the upright shall guide them;

4.verse: Riches profit not in the day of wrath;

5.verse: The righteousness of the perfect shall  direct his way;

6.verse: The righteousness of the upright shall deliver them;

7.verse: When a wicked man dieth, his expectation shall perish;

8.verse: The righteous is delivered out of trouble;

9.verse: With his mouth the godless man destroyeth his neighbor;

10.verse: When it goeth well with the righteous, the city rejoiceth;

11.verse: By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted;

12.verse: He that despiseth his neighbor is void of  wisdom;

13.verse: He that goeth about as a tale-bearer revealeth secrets;

14.verse: Where no wise guidance is, the people falleth;

15.verse: He that is surety for a stranger  shall smart for it;

16.verse: A gracious woman obtaineth honor;

17.verse: The merciful man doeth good to his own soul;

18.verse: The wicked earneth deceitful wages;

19.verse: He that is stedfast in righteousness shall attain unto life;

20.verse: They that are perverse in heart are an abomination to Jehovah;

21.verse: Though hand join in hand, the evil man shall not be unpunished;

22.verse: As a ring of gold in a swine’s snout,

23.verse: The desire of the righteous is only good;

24.verse: There is that scattereth, and increaseth yet more;

25.verse: The liberal soul shall be made fat;

26.verse: He that withholdeth grain, the people shall curse him;

27.verse: He that diligently seeketh good seeketh favor;

28.verse: He that trusteth in his riches shall fall;

29.verse: He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind;

30.verse: The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life;

31.verse: Behold, the righteous shall be recompensed in the earth;

1.verse: Whoso loveth  correction loveth knowledge;

2.verse: A good man shall obtain favor of Jehovah;

3.verse: A man shall not be established by wickedness;

4.verse: A worthy woman is the crown of her husband;

5.verse: The thoughts of the righteous are just;

6.verse: The words of the wicked  are of lying in wait for blood;

7.verse: The wicked are overthrown, and are not;

8.verse: A man shall be commended according to his wisdom;

9.verse: Better is he that is lightly esteemed, and hath a servant,

10.verse: A righteous man regardeth the life of his beast;

11.verse: He that tilleth his land shall have plenty of bread;

12.verse: The wicked desireth  the net of evil men;

13.verse: In the transgression of the lips is  a snare to the evil man;

14.verse: A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth;

15.verse: The way of a fool is right in his own eyes;

16.verse: A fool’s vexation is  presently known;

17.verse: He that  uttereth truth showeth forth righteousness;

18.verse: There is that speaketh rashly like the piercings of a sword;

19.verse: The lip of truth shall be established for ever;

20.verse: Deceit is in the heart of them that devise evil;

21.verse: There shall no mischief happen to the righteous;

22.verse: Lying lips are an abomination to Jehovah;

23.verse: A prudent man concealeth knowledge;

24.verse: The hand of the diligent shall bear rule;

25.verse: Heaviness in the heart of a man maketh it stoop;

26.verse: The righteous is a guide to his neighbor;

27.verse: The slothful man  roasteth not that which he took in hunting;

28.verse: In the way of righteousness is life;

1.verse: A wise son heareth his father’s  instruction;

2.verse: A man shall eat good  by the fruit of his mouth;

3.verse: He that guardeth his mouth keepeth his life;

4.verse: The soul of the sluggard desireth, and hath nothing;

5.verse: A righteous man hateth lying;

6.verse: Righteousness guardeth  him that is upright in the way;

7.verse: There is that  maketh himself rich, yet hath nothing:

8.verse: The ransom of a man’s life is his riches;

9.verse: The light of the righteous rejoiceth;

10.verse: By pride cometh only contention;

11.verse: Wealth gotten by vanity shall be diminished;

12.verse: Hope deferred maketh the heart sick;

13.verse: Whoso despiseth the word  bringeth destruction on himself;

14.verse: The  law of the wise is a fountain of life,

15.verse: Good understanding  giveth favor;

16.verse: Every prudent man worketh with knowledge;

17.verse: A wicked messenger falleth into evil;

18.verse: Poverty and shame shall be to him that refuseth  correction;

19.verse: The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul;

20.verse: Walk with wise men, and thou shalt be wise;

21.verse: Evil pursueth sinners;

22.verse: A good man leaveth an inheritance to his children’s children;

23.verse: Much food is in the  tillage of the poor;

24.verse: He that spareth his rod hateth his son;

25.verse: The righteous eateth to the satisfying of his soul;

1.verse: Every wise woman buildeth her house;

2.verse: He that walketh in his uprightness feareth Jehovah;

3.verse: In the mouth of the foolish is a rod for his pride;

4.verse: Where no oxen are, the crib is clean;

5.verse: A faithful witness will not lie;

6.verse: A scoffer seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not;

7.verse: Go into the presence of a foolish man,

8.verse: The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way;

9.verse: A trespass-offering mocketh fools;

10.verse: The heart knoweth its own bitterness;

11.verse: The house of the wicked shall be overthrown;

12.verse: There is a way which  seemeth right unto a man;

13.verse: Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful;

14.verse: The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways;

15.verse: The simple believeth every word;

16.verse: A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil;

17.verse: He that is soon angry will deal foolishly;

18.verse: The simple inherit folly;

19.verse: The evil bow down before the good;

20.verse: The poor is hated even of his own neighbor;

21.verse: He that despiseth his neighbor sinneth;

22.verse: Do they not err that devise evil?

23.verse: In all labor there is profit;

24.verse: The crown of the wise is their riches;

25.verse: A true witness delivereth souls;

26.verse: In the fear of Jehovah is strong confidence;

27.verse: The fear of Jehovah is a fountain of life,

28.verse: In the multitude of people is the king’s glory;

29.verse: He that is slow to anger is of great understanding;

30.verse: A tranquil heart is the life of the flesh;

31.verse: He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker;

32.verse: The wicked is thrust down in his  evil-doing;

33.verse: Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding;

35.verse: The king’s favor is toward a servant that dealeth wisely;

1.verse: A soft answer turneth away wrath;

2.verse: The tongue of the wise uttereth knowledge aright;

3.verse: The eyes of Jehovah are in every place,

4.verse: A gentle tongue is a tree of life;

5.verse: A fool despiseth his father’s  correction;

6.verse: In the house of the righteous is much treasure;

7.verse: The lips of the wise disperse knowledge;

8.verse: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to Jehovah;

9.verse: The way of the wicked is an abomination to Jehovah;

10.verse: There is grievous correction for him that forsaketh the way;

11.verse: Sheol and  Abaddon are before Jehovah;

12.verse: A scoffer loveth not to be reproved;

13.verse: A glad heart maketh a cheerful countenance;

14.verse: The heart of him that hath understanding seeketh knowledge;

15.verse: All the days of the afflicted are evil;

16.verse: Better is little, with the fear of Jehovah,

17.verse: Better is a  dinner of herbs, where love is,

18.verse: A wrathful man stirreth up contention;

19.verse: The way of the sluggard is as a hedge of thorns;

20.verse: A wise son maketh a glad father;

21.verse: Folly is joy to him that is void of  wisdom;

22.verse: Where there is no counsel, purposes are disappointed;

23.verse: A man hath joy in the answer of his mouth;

24.verse: To the wise the way of life goeth upward,

25.verse: Jehovah will root up the house of the proud;

26.verse: Evil devices are an abomination to Jehovah;

27.verse: He that is greedy of gain troubleth his own house;

28.verse: The heart of the righteous studieth to answer;

29.verse: Jehovah is far from the wicked;

30.verse: The light of the eyes rejoiceth the heart;

31.verse: The ear that hearkeneth to the reproof of life

32.verse: He that refuseth  correction despiseth his own soul;

33.verse: The fear of Jehovah is the instruction of wisdom;

1.verse: The plans of the heart belong to man;

2.verse: All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes;

3.verse: Commit thy works unto Jehovah,

4.verse: Jehovah hath made everything for  its own end;

5.verse: Every one that is proud in heart is an abomination to Jehovah:

6.verse: By mercy and truth iniquity is atoned for;

7.verse: When a man’s ways please Jehovah,

8.verse: Better is a little, with righteousness,

9.verse: A man’s heart deviseth his way;

10.verse: A divine sentence is in the lips of the king;

11.verse: A just balance and scales are Jehovah’s;

12.verse: It is an abomination to kings to commit wickedness;

13.verse: Righteous lips are the delight of kings;

14.verse: The wrath of a king is as messengers of death;

15.verse: In the light of the king’s countenance is life;

16.verse: How much better is it to get wisdom than gold!

17.verse: The highway of the upright is to depart from evil:

18.verse: Pride goeth before destruction,

19.verse: Better it is to be of a lowly spirit with the  poor,

20.verse: He that  giveth heed unto the word shall find good;

21.verse: The wise in heart shall be called prudent;

22.verse: Understanding is a well-spring of life unto him that hath it;

23.verse: The heart of the wise instructeth his mouth,

24.verse: Pleasant words are as a honeycomb,

25.verse: There is a way which  seemeth right unto a man,

26.verse: The appetite of the laboring man laboreth for him;

27.verse: A worthless man  deviseth mischief;

28.verse: A perverse man scattereth abroad strife;

29.verse: A man of violence enticeth his neighbor,

30.verse: He that shutteth his eyes, it is to devise perverse things:

31.verse: The hoary head is a crown of  glory;

32.verse: He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty;

33.verse: The lot is cast into the lap;

1.verse: Better is a dry morsel, and quietness therewith,

2.verse: A servant that dealeth wisely shall have rule over a son that  causeth shame,

3.verse: The refining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold;

4.verse: An evil-doer giveth heed to wicked lips;

5.verse: Whoso mocketh the poor reproacheth his Maker;

6.verse: Children’s children are the crown of old men;

7.verse: Excellent speech becometh not a fool;

8.verse: A bribe is as a precious stone in the eyes of him that hath it;

9.verse: He that covereth a transgression seeketh love;

10.verse: A rebuke entereth deeper into one that hath understanding

11.verse: An evil man seeketh only rebellion;

12.verse: Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man,

13.verse: Whoso rewardeth evil for good,

14.verse: The beginning of strife is as when one letteth out water:

15.verse: He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the righteous,

16.verse: Wherefore is there a price in the hand of a fool to buy wisdom,

17.verse: A friend loveth at all times;

18.verse: A man void of  understanding striketh hands,

19.verse: He loveth transgression that loveth strife:

20.verse: He that hath a wayward heart findeth no good;

21.verse: He that begetteth a fool doeth it to his sorrow;

22.verse: A cheerful heart  is a good medicine;

23.verse: A wicked man receiveth a bribe out of the bosom,

24.verse: Wisdom is before the face of him that hath understanding;

25.verse: A foolish son is a grief to his father,

26.verse: Also to  punish the righteous is not good,

27.verse: He  that spareth his words hath knowledge;

28.verse: Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise;

1.verse: He that separateth himself seeketh his own desire,

2.verse: A fool hath no delight in understanding,

3.verse: When the wicked cometh, there cometh also contempt,

4.verse: The words of a man’s mouth are as deep waters;

5.verse: To respect the person of the wicked is not good,

6.verse: A fool’s lips  enter into contention,

7.verse: A fool’s mouth is his destruction,

8.verse: The words of a whisperer are as dainty morsels,

9.verse: He also that is slack in his work

10.verse: The name of Jehovah is a strong tower;

11.verse: The rich man’s wealth is his strong city,

12.verse: Before destruction the heart of man is haughty;

13.verse: He that giveth answer before he heareth,

14.verse: The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity;

15.verse: The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge;

16.verse: A man’s gift maketh room for him,

17.verse: He that pleadeth his cause first seemeth just;

18.verse: The lot causeth contentions to cease,

19.verse: A brother  offended is harder to be won than a strong city;

20.verse: A man’s belly shall be filled with the fruit of his mouth;

21.verse: Death and life are in the power of the tongue;

22.verse: Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing,

23.verse: The poor useth entreaties;

24.verse: He that maketh many friends doeth it to his own destruction;

1.verse: Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity

2.verse: Also,  that the soul be without knowledge is not good;

3.verse: The foolishness of man subverteth his way;

4.verse: Wealth addeth many friends;

5.verse: A false witness shall not be unpunished;

6.verse: Many will entreat the favor of  the liberal man;

7.verse: All the brethren of the poor do hate him:

8.verse: He that getteth  wisdom loveth his own soul:

9.verse: A false witness shall not be unpunished;

10.verse: Delicate living is not seemly for a fool;

11.verse: The discretion of a man maketh him slow to anger;

12.verse: The king’s wrath is as the roaring of a lion;

13.verse: A foolish son is the calamity of his father;

14.verse: House and riches are an inheritance from fathers;

15.verse: Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep;

16.verse: He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his soul;

17.verse: He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto Jehovah,

18.verse: Chasten thy son, seeing there is hope;

19.verse: A man of great wrath shall bear the penalty;

20.verse: Hear counsel, and receive  instruction,

21.verse: There are many devices in a man’s heart;

22.verse: That which maketh a man to be desired is his kindness;

23.verse: The fear of Jehovah tendeth to life;

24.verse: The sluggard burieth his hand in the dish,

25.verse: Smite a scoffer, and the simple will learn prudence;

26.verse: He that doeth violence to his father, and chaseth away his mother,

27.verse: Cease, my son, to hear instruction

28.verse: A worthless witness mocketh at justice;

1.verse: Wine is a mocker, strong drink a brawler;

2.verse: The terror of a king is as the roaring of a lion:

3.verse: It is an honor for a man to  keep aloof from strife;

4.verse: The sluggard will not plow by reason of the winter;

5.verse: Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water;

6.verse: Most men will proclaim every one his own kindness;

7.verse: A righteous man that walketh in his integrity,

8.verse: A king that sitteth on the throne of judgment

9.verse: Who can say, I have made my heart clean,

10.verse: Diverse weights, and diverse measures,

11.verse: Even a child maketh himself known by his doings,

12.verse: The hearing ear, and the seeing eye,

13.verse: Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty;

14.verse: It is bad, it is bad, saith the buyer;

15.verse: There is gold, and abundance of rubies;

16.verse: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger;

17.verse: Bread of falsehood is sweet to a man;

18.verse: Every purpose is established by counsel;

19.verse: He that goeth about as a tale-bearer revealeth secrets;

20.verse: Whoso curseth his father or his mother,

21.verse: An inheritance may be gotten hastily at the beginning;

22.verse: Say not thou, I will recompense evil:

23.verse: Diverse weights are an abomination to Jehovah;

24.verse: A man’s goings are of Jehovah;

25.verse: It is a snare to a man  rashly to say, It is holy,

26.verse: A wise king winnoweth the wicked,

27.verse: The spirit of man is the lamp of Jehovah,

28.verse: Kindness and truth preserve the king;

29.verse: The glory of young men is their strength;

30.verse: Stripes that wound cleanse away evil;

1.verse: The king’s heart is in the hand of Jehovah as the watercourses:

2.verse: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes;

3.verse: To do righteousness and justice

4.verse: A high look, and a proud heart,

5.verse: The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness;

6.verse: The getting of treasures by a lying tongue

7.verse: The violence of the wicked shall sweep them away,

8.verse: The way of him that is laden with guilt is exceeding crooked;

9.verse: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop,

10.verse: The soul of the wicked desireth evil:

11.verse: When the scoffer is punished, the simple is made wise;

12.verse: The righteous man considereth the house of the wicked,

13.verse: Whoso stoppeth his ears at the cry of the poor,

14.verse: A gift in secret  pacifieth anger;

15.verse: It is joy to the righteous to do justice;

16.verse: The man that wandereth out of the way of understanding

17.verse: He that loveth pleasure shall be a poor man:

18.verse: The wicked is a ransom for the righteous;

19.verse: It is better to dwell in a desert land,

20.verse: There is precious treasure and oil in the dwelling of the wise;

21.verse: He that followeth after righteousness and kindness

22.verse: A wise man scaleth the city of the mighty,

23.verse: Whoso keepeth his mouth and his tongue

24.verse: The proud and haughty man, scoffer is his name;

25.verse: The desire of the sluggard killeth him;

26.verse: There is that coveteth greedily all the day long;

27.verse: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination;

28.verse: A false witness shall perish;

29.verse: A wicked man hardeneth his face;

30.verse: There is no wisdom nor understanding

31.verse: The horse is prepared against the day of battle;

1.verse: A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches,

2.verse: The rich and the poor meet together:

3.verse: A prudent man seeth the evil, and hideth himself;

4.verse: The reward of humility and the fear of Jehovah

5.verse: Thorns and snares are in the way of the perverse:

6.verse: Train up a child  in the way he should go,

7.verse: The rich ruleth over the poor;

8.verse: He that soweth iniquity shall reap  calamity;

9.verse: He that hath a  bountiful eye shall be blessed;

10.verse: Cast out the scoffer, and contention will go out;

11.verse: He that loveth  pureness of heart,

12.verse: The eyes of Jehovah preserve him that hath knowledge;

13.verse: The sluggard saith, There is a lion without;

14.verse: The mouth of strange women is a deep pit;

15.verse: Foolishness is bound up in the heart of a child;

16.verse: He that oppresseth the poor to increase his gain ,

17.verse: Incline thine ear, and hear the words of the wise,

18.verse: For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee,

19.verse: That thy trust may be in Jehovah,

20.verse: Have not I written unto thee  excellent things

21.verse: To make thee know  the certainty of the words of truth,

22.verse: Rob not the poor,  because he is poor;

23.verse: For Jehovah will plead their cause,

24.verse: Make no friendship with a man that is given to anger;

25.verse: Lest thou learn his ways,

26.verse: Be thou not one of them that strike hands,

27.verse: If thou hast not wherewith to pay,

28.verse: Remove not the ancient landmark,

29.verse: Seest thou a man  diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings;

1.verse: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler,

2.verse: And put a knife to thy throat,

3.verse: Be not desirous of his dainties;

4.verse: Weary not thyself to be rich;

5.verse: Wilt thou set thine eyes upon that which is not?

6.verse: Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye,

7.verse: For  as he thinketh within himself, so is he:

8.verse: The morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up,

9.verse: Speak not in the hearing of a fool;

10.verse: Remove not the ancient landmark;

11.verse: For their Redeemer is strong;

12.verse: Apply thy heart unto  instruction,

13.verse: Withhold not correction from the child;

14.verse: Thou shalt beat him with the rod,

15.verse: My son, if thy heart be wise,

16.verse: Yea, my  heart will rejoice,

17.verse: Let not thy heart envy sinners;

18.verse: For surely there is a  reward;

19.verse: Hear thou, my son, and be wise,

20.verse: Be not among winebibbers,

21.verse: For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty;

22.verse: Hearken unto thy father that begat thee,

23.verse: Buy the truth, and sell it not;

24.verse: The father of the righteous will greatly rejoice;

25.verse: Let thy father and thy mother be glad,

26.verse: My son, give me thy heart;

27.verse: For a harlot is a deep ditch;

28.verse: Yea, she lieth in wait  as a robber,

29.verse: Who hath  woe? who hath  sorrow? who hath contentions?

30.verse: They that tarry long at the wine;

31.verse: Look not thou upon the wine when it is red,

32.verse: At the last it biteth like a serpent,

33.verse: Thine eyes shall behold  strange things,

34.verse: Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea,

35.verse: They have stricken me, shalt thou say , and I was not hurt;

1.verse: Be not thou envious against evil men;

2.verse: For their heart studieth oppression,

3.verse: Through wisdom is a house builded;

4.verse: And by knowledge are the chambers filled

5.verse: A wise man  is strong;

6.verse: For by wise guidance thou shalt make thy war;

7.verse: Wisdom is too high for a fool:

8.verse: He that deviseth to do evil,

9.verse: The thought of foolishness is sin;

10.verse: If thou faint in the day of adversity,

11.verse: Deliver them that are carried away unto death,

12.verse: If thou sayest, Behold, we knew not  this;

13.verse: My son, eat thou honey, for it is good;

14.verse: So shalt thou know wisdom to be unto thy soul;

15.verse: Lay not wait,  O wicked man, against the  habitation of the righteous;

16.verse: For a righteous man falleth seven times, and riseth up again;

17.verse: Rejoice not when thine enemy falleth,

18.verse: Lest Jehovah see it, and it displease him,

19.verse: Fret not thyself because of evil-doers;

20.verse: For there shall be no reward to the evil man;

21.verse: My son, fear thou Jehovah and the king;

22.verse: For their calamity shall rise suddenly;

23.verse: These also are sayings of the wise.

24.verse: He that saith unto the wicked, Thou art righteous,

25.verse: But to them that rebuke him shall be delight,

26.verse: He  kisseth the lips

27.verse: Prepare thy work without,

28.verse: Be not a witness against thy neighbor without cause;

29.verse: Say not, I will do so to him as he hath done to me;

30.verse: I went by the field of the sluggard,

31.verse: And, lo, it was all grown over with thorns,

32.verse: Then I beheld, and considered well;

33.verse: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber,

34.verse: So shall thy poverty come as a robber,

1.verse: These also are proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.

2.verse: It is the glory of God to conceal a thing;

3.verse: As the heavens for height, and the earth for depth,

4.verse: Take away the dross from the silver,

5.verse: Take away the wicked from before the king,

6.verse: Put not thyself forward in the presence of the king,

7.verse: For better is it that it be said unto thee, Come up hither,

8.verse: Go not forth hastily to strive,

9.verse: Debate thy cause with thy neighbor himself ,

10.verse: Lest he that heareth it revile thee,

11.verse: A word  fitly spoken

12.verse: As  an ear-ring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold,

13.verse: As the cold of snow in the time of harvest,

14.verse: As clouds and wind without rain,

15.verse: By long forbearing is a  ruler persuaded,

16.verse: Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee,

17.verse: Let thy foot be seldom in thy neighbor’s house,

18.verse: A man that beareth false witness against his neighbor

19.verse: Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble

20.verse: As one that taketh off a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon soda,

21.verse: If  thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat;

22.verse: For thou wilt heap coals of fire upon his head,

23.verse: The north wind bringeth forth rain;

24.verse: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop,

25.verse: As cold waters to a  thirsty soul,

26.verse: As a  troubled fountain, and a corrupted spring,

27.verse: It is not good to eat much honey;

28.verse: He whose spirit is without restraint

1.verse: As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest,

2.verse: As the sparrow in her wandering, as the swallow in her flying,

3.verse: A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass,

4.verse: Answer not a fool according to his folly,

5.verse: Answer a fool according to his folly,

6.verse: He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool

7.verse: The legs of the lame hang loose;

8.verse: As one that bindeth a stone in a sling,

9.verse: As a thorn that goeth up into the hand of a drunkard,

10.verse: As an archer that woundeth all,

11.verse: As a dog that returneth to his vomit,

12.verse: Seest thou a man wise in  his own conceit?

13.verse: The sluggard saith, There is a lion in the way;

14.verse: As the door turneth upon its hinges,

15.verse: The sluggard burieth his hand in the dish;

16.verse: The sluggard is wiser in  his own conceit

17.verse: He that passeth by, and vexeth himself with strife belonging not to him,

18.verse: As a madman who casteth firebrands,

19.verse: So is the man that deceiveth his neighbor,

20.verse: For lack of wood the fire goeth out;

21.verse: As coals are to hot embers, and wood to fire,

22.verse: The words of a whisperer are as dainty morsels,

23.verse: Fervent lips and a wicked heart

24.verse: He that hateth dissembleth with his lips;

25.verse: When he speaketh fair, believe him not;

26.verse: Though his hatred cover itself with guile,

27.verse: Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein;

28.verse: A lying tongue hateth those whom it hath  wounded;

1.verse: Boast not thyself of tomorrow;

2.verse: Let another man praise thee, and not thine own mouth;

3.verse: A stone is heavy, and the sand weighty;

4.verse: Wrath is cruel, and anger is  overwhelming;

5.verse: Better is open rebuke

6.verse: Faithful are the wounds of a friend;

7.verse: The full soul  loatheth a honeycomb;

8.verse: As a bird that wandereth from her nest,

9.verse: Oil and perfume rejoice the heart;

10.verse: Thine own friend, and thy father’s friend, forsake not;

11.verse: My son, be wise, and make my heart glad,

12.verse: A prudent man seeth the evil, and hideth himself;

13.verse: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger;

14.verse: He that blesseth his friend with a loud voice, rising early in the morning,

15.verse: A continual dropping in a very rainy day

16.verse: He that would  restrain her  restraineth the wind;

17.verse: Iron sharpeneth iron;

18.verse: Whoso keepeth the fig-tree shall eat the fruit thereof;

19.verse: As in water face answereth to face,

20.verse: Sheol and Abaddon are never satisfied;

21.verse: The refining pot is for silver, and the furnace for gold;

22.verse: Though thou shouldest bray a fool in a mortar with a pestle along with bruised grain,

23.verse: Be thou diligent to know the state of thy flocks,

24.verse: For riches are not for ever;

25.verse: The  hay is carried, and the tender grass showeth itself,

26.verse: The lambs are for thy clothing,

27.verse: And there will be goats’ milk enough for thy food, for the food of thy household,

1.verse: The wicked flee when no man pursueth;

2.verse: For the transgression of a land many are the princes thereof;

3.verse: A needy man that oppresseth the poor

4.verse: They that forsake the law praise the wicked;

5.verse: Evil men understand not justice;

6.verse: Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity,

7.verse: Whoso keepeth the law is a wise son;

8.verse: He that augmenteth his substance by interest and increase,

9.verse: He that turneth away his ear from hearing the law,

10.verse: Whoso causeth the upright to go astray in an evil way,

11.verse: The rich man is wise in  his own conceit;

12.verse: When the righteous triumph, there is great glory;

13.verse: He that covereth his transgressions shall not prosper;

14.verse: Happy is the man that feareth alway;

15.verse: As a roaring lion, and a ranging bear,

16.verse: The prince that lacketh understanding is also a great oppressor;

17.verse: A man that is laden with the blood of any person

18.verse: Whoso walketh uprightly shall be delivered;

19.verse: He that tilleth his land shall have plenty of bread;

20.verse: A faithful man shall abound with blessings;

21.verse: To have respect of persons is not good;

22.verse: He that hath an evil eye hasteth after riches,

23.verse: He that rebuketh a man shall afterward find more favor

24.verse: Whoso robbeth his father or his mother, and saith, It is no transgression,

25.verse: He that is of a greedy spirit stirreth up strife;

26.verse: He that trusteth in his own heart is a fool;

27.verse: He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack;

28.verse: When the wicked rise, men hide themselves;

1.verse: He that being often reproved hardeneth his neck

2.verse: When the righteous  are increased, the people rejoice;

3.verse: Whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father;

4.verse: The king by justice establisheth the land;

5.verse: A man that flattereth his neighbor

6.verse: In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare;

7.verse: The righteous taketh knowledge of the cause of the poor;

8.verse: Scoffers set a city in a flame;

9.verse: If a wise man hath a controversy with a foolish man,

10.verse: The bloodthirsty hate him that is perfect;

11.verse: A fool uttereth all his  anger;

12.verse: If a ruler hearkeneth to falsehood,

13.verse: The poor man and the oppressor meet together;

14.verse: The king that faithfully judgeth the poor,

15.verse: The rod and reproof give wisdom;

16.verse: When the wicked  are increased, transgression increaseth;

17.verse: Correct thy son, and he will give thee rest;

18.verse: Where there is no vision, the people cast off restraint;

19.verse: A servant will not be corrected by words;

20.verse: Seest thou a man that is hasty in his  words?

21.verse: He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child

22.verse: An angry man stirreth up strife,

23.verse: A man’s pride shall bring him low;

24.verse: Whoso is partner with a thief hateth his own soul;

25.verse: The fear of man bringeth a snare;

26.verse: Many seek the ruler’s favor;

27.verse: An unjust man is an abomination to the righteous;

1.verse: The words of Agur the son of  Jakeh; the  oracle.

2.verse: Surely I am more brutish than any man,

3.verse: And I have not learned wisdom,

4.verse: Who hath ascended up into heaven, and descended?

5.verse: Every word of God is  tried:

6.verse: Add thou not unto his words,

7.verse: Two things have I asked of thee;

8.verse: Remove far from me falsehood and lies;

9.verse: Lest I be full, and deny thee , and say, Who is Jehovah?

10.verse: Slander not a servant unto his master,

11.verse: There is a generation that curse their father,

12.verse: There is a generation that are pure in their own eyes,

13.verse: There is a generation, oh how lofty are their eyes!

14.verse: There is a generation whose teeth are as swords, and their jaw teeth as knives,

15.verse: The  horseleach hath two daughters,  crying , Give, give.

16.verse: Sheol; and the barren womb;

17.verse: The eye that mocketh at his father,

18.verse: There are three things which are too wonderful for me,

19.verse: The way of an eagle in the air;

20.verse: So is the way of an adulterous woman;

21.verse: For three things the earth doth tremble,

22.verse: For a servant when he is king;

23.verse: For an odious woman when she is married;

24.verse: There are four things which are little upon the earth,

25.verse: The ants are a people not strong,

26.verse: The conies are but a feeble folk,

27.verse: The locusts have no king,

28.verse: The lizard  taketh hold with her hands,

29.verse: There are three things which are stately in their march,

30.verse: The lion, which is mightiest among beasts,

32.verse: If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself,

33.verse: For the  churning of milk bringeth forth butter,

1.verse: The words of king Lemuel; the  oracle which his mother taught him.

2.verse: What, my son? and what, O son of my womb?

3.verse: Give not thy strength unto women,

4.verse: It is not for kings, O Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine;

5.verse: Lest they drink, and forget  the law,

6.verse: Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish,

7.verse: Let him drink, and forget his poverty,

8.verse: Open thy mouth for the dumb,

9.verse: Open thy mouth, judge righteously,

10.verse: A worthy woman who can find?

11.verse: The heart of her husband trusteth in her,

12.verse: She doeth him good and not evil

13.verse: She seeketh wool and flax,

14.verse: She is like the merchant-ships;

15.verse: She riseth also while it is yet night,

16.verse: She considereth a field, and buyeth it;

17.verse: She girdeth her loins with strength,

18.verse: She perceiveth that her merchandise is profitable;

19.verse: She layeth her hands to the distaff,

20.verse: She stretcheth out her  hand to the poor;

21.verse: She is not afraid of the snow for her household;

22.verse: She maketh for herself  carpets of tapestry;

23.verse: Her husband is known in the gates,

24.verse: She maketh linen garments and selleth them,

25.verse: Strength and dignity are her clothing;

26.verse: She openeth her mouth with wisdom;

27.verse: She looketh well to the ways of her household,

28.verse: Her children rise up, and call her blessed;

30.verse: Grace is deceitful, and beauty is vain;

31.verse: Give her of the fruit of her hands;
